meanings.definition: To moisten (meat) with drippings, butter, etc., while cooking.
meanings.sent1: Mom asked me to baste the chicken with some melted butter.
meanings.sent2: It is important to baste the turkey to keep it juicy while roasting.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally basted the steak with maple syrup instead of oil!
meanings.sent4: The chef's secret to a flavorful roast is to baste it with a special herb mixture.
meanings.sent5: The sizzling sound of the meat as I baste it fills the kitchen with a delicious aroma.

meanings.definition: To sew with long, loose stitches.
meanings.sent1: I need to baste the fabric before sewing it together permanently.
meanings.sent2: She decided to baste the hem of the dress to ensure it was even.
meanings.sent3: In sewing class, I accidentally basted the wrong pieces together!
meanings.sent4: The tailor carefully basted the delicate lace to the gown.
meanings.sent5: As I baste the fabric, I can feel the texture changing under my fingers.
